text:
At the moment you can't select the level of compression you want on the gzip task - this would be useful in certain scenarios for example compressing changelogs for Debian packages (lintian throws a warning if it's not using maximum compression.)

This would be nice to have as a separate attribute.
creator: berry120@gmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
While I agree this would e a nice feature, it is not feasible for the core task without rewriting it completely.  The core gzip task is based on java.util.zip.GZIPOutputStream which doesn't provide any control over the compression level.

The gzip task of the compress Antlib is a different beast as Conmmons Compress' trunk has moved away from using GZIPInputStream in order to support files that contain multipile compressed streams.  It would be possible to re-implement GZipCompressorOutputStream over there as well and then make the compression level configurable.  Not that I'd advise you to hold your breath ...

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: added to Compress Antlib with svn revision 1577923
